data.headline: S&P 500, Nasdaq, Dow, and Russell 2000 all gained 0.6%–1.3% with tech leading the advance.
bullets: Nvidia rallied on news of a multi-year GPU supply deal with Meta, set to deploy millions of Nvidia processors.
Apple rose on accelerated AI-wearables initiatives, boosting sentiment in chip and software names.
Analog Devices jumped after an earnings beat, while Cadence and Synopsys gained on strong outlooks and Nvidia stake exposure.
Palantir and Amazon also advanced as AI and tech optimism lifted the sector.
Palo Alto Networks dropped 7%–8% despite beating estimates, as cybersecurity AI concerns weighed on the stock.
MSG Sports climbed on plans to split Knicks and Rangers franchises; Wingstop, Garmin, and Moderna also posted gains.
Genuine Parts lagged the broader market.
Traders focused on the upcoming January FOMC/Fed minutes and key earnings from Analog Devices, eBay, and DoorDash.
Durable goods data beat expectations, housing data was mixed, Treasury yields hovered near multiweek lows, and gold traded above $4,900.
